intro: Pedicularis scopulorum, commonly known as the alpine sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually unbranched and erect. Pedicularis scopulorum is a perennial herb that plays an important ecological role in high-altitude ecosystems.
